Class JsText

                      js.dom.DOM2Core.CharacterData.Prototype
                          js.user.JsCharacterData
                              js.dom.DOM2Core.Text.Prototype
                                  js.user.JsText
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectLike
Direct Known Subclasses:
DOM2Core.CDATASection.Prototype
public class JsText
extends DOM2Core.Text.Prototype

An opaque class representing JavaScript client-side objects of the global JsClient.Text class.

A JsText node represents a run of plain text in an HTML or XML document. Plain text appears within HTML and XML elements and attributes, and JsText nodes typically appear as children of JsElement and JsAttr nodes. JsText nodes inherit from JsCharacterData, and the textual content of a JsText node is available through the JsCharacterData.data property inherited from JsCharacterData or through the JsNode.nodeValue property inherited from JsNode. JsText nodes may be manipulated using any of the methods inherited from JsCharacterData or with the splitText(Number) method defined by JsText itself. Create a new JsText node with JsDocument.createTextNode(String). JsText nodes never have children.

See JsNode.normalize() for a way to remove empty JsText nodes and merge adjacent JsText nodes from a subtree of a document.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
JsNode.normalize()
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects. The checkcast operation to the class literal of this interface must be ignored and instanceof to it always true.

splitText

public JsText splitText(java.lang.Number offset)

Splits this JsText node into two at the specified character position and returns the new JsText node.

This method splits a JsText node in two at the specified offset. The original JsText node is modified so that it contains all text content up to, but not including, the character at position offset. A new JsText node is created to contain all the characters from and including the position offset to the end of the string. The new JsText node is the return value of the method. Additionally, if the original JsText node has a JsNode.parentNode, the new node is inserted into this parent node immediately after the original node.

JsCDATASection inherits from JsText. The newly created node of JsCDATASection.splitText(Number) is a JsCDATASection node rather than a JsText node.

Parameters:
offset - The character position at which to split the JsText node.
Returns:
The JsText node that was split from this node.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if the node is read-only and may not be modified or the value JsDOMException.INDEX_SIZE_ERR if offset is negative or is greater than the length of the JsText or JsComment node. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
splitText(NumberLike)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

splitText

public JsText splitText(NumberLike<?> offset)

Splits this JsText node into two at the specified character position and returns the new JsText node.

This method splits a JsText node in two at the specified offset. The original JsText node is modified so that it contains all text content up to, but not including, the character at position offset. A new JsText node is created to contain all the characters from and including the position offset to the end of the string. The new JsText node is the return value of the method. Additionally, if the original JsText node has a JsNode.parentNode, the new node is inserted into this parent node immediately after the original node.

JsCDATASection inherits from JsText. The newly created node of JsCDATASection.splitText(NumberLike) is a JsCDATASection node rather than a JsText node.
